page.title: 01Banham - the years of change
page.content: A mainly agricultural area of large fields where many hedges have been removed-crops are wheat, barley, beet, rape with some dairying. patches of old woodland remain. The village centre of Banham has changed little for centuries-picturesque green surrounded by lime trees and dominated by the large flint church. The chicken processing factory near the centre provides some employment. Plans to make the old cider factory a pottery are possible. The mixture of the population has changed with a number of younger families moving into the area. The abbatoir increass the number of large continental lorries through small local roads. The village school has 70 pupils from 5-11 years and three teachers. The village activities take place in a small church room. The Old Rectory
